meanings.definition: Having greater strength or power than something else.
meanings.sent1: The lion is mightier than the rabbit.
meanings.sent2: Superheroes are often depicted as mightier than regular humans.
meanings.sent3: In the land of toys, the toy soldier thought he was mightier than the teddy bear.
meanings.sent4: The pen is mightier than the sword, they say, but actions speak louder than words.
meanings.sent5: The storm grew mightier as it approached the coast, unleashing its fury.

meanings.definition: More powerful or influential than something else.
meanings.sent1: The king believed his crown made him mightier than all his subjects.
meanings.sent2: In the world of technology, newer devices are often considered mightier than older ones.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand felt mightier than any other wand in the magic shop.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was mightier than any weapon, disarming even the toughest of foes.
meanings.sent5: The sun, with its warmth and light, is mightier than any artificial source of energy.
